items.name: MIDDENMEER
items.remarks:
Two-way radio communication on channel 123.430 is required. Middenmeer has no manned ground station. All radio-communication is air-to-air. 
Pilots will report position and intentions to inform other traffic.

items.name: EAST KIRKBY

hoursOfOperation.remarks:
Ops hrs: Easter to Oct. 0930-1700.
Oct. to Easter 1000-1600.
CLSD on SUN

items.remarks:
Private aerodrome operated by the Lincolnshire Aviation Heritage Center.
Pilots using East Kirkby do so at thier own risk.
All circuits to the South 800ft AAL.
Do not overfly East Kirkby village nor the house at the NE side of the airfield.
Use RWY 08/26 in preference. RWY 06/24 inly avbl if specially briefed in advance by telephone.
Damage area North of the RWY is to be avoided.
Park on the grass by hedge, not on the apron.
WARNING: ACFT and aero modellers may operate

items.name: CONSTHUM PARAGLIDING

frequencies.name: WESTON ON THE GREEN DROP ZONE

items.name: HINTON IN HEDGES
items.remarks:
Runways 06/24 Hard and Grass.  Tarmac and grass running in parallel.  The south side grass is used primarily for the gliders when the wind direct dictates.  Please talk on the local frequency before entering the right hand circuit
Runways 09/27.  Grass only.  The grass is used primarily for the gliders when the wind direct dictates.  Please talk on the local frequency before entering the right hand circuit
Runway 33. Grass only and short.  While landable, 15 should only be used in emergencies.

There is evidence of a 09/27 concrete - but this is dangerous to land on - 1940's concrete that has now broken up but is usable for driving vehicles and towing gliders.
The side of 06/24 hard is also broken.  Stick to the black stuff

There is a robust group of local power flyers, including an AN-20

There is a major Sky Dive centre that operates Tuesday to Sunday and Bank holiday Mondays until sunset

items.name: ETAIN ROUVRES
items.remarks:
AD with restricted use and prohibited to ACFT without radio
For ACFT proceeding in GAT rules:
AD strictly reserved for ACFT based in a radius of 40 NM centered on Etain and whose registration is listed in the protocols between the 3rd combat HEL regiment and their ACB. 
The access to the airfield is only possible by day during ATS working hours and under VMC
Civilian ACFT : can only use the RWY and the TWY

items.name: MELUN VILLAROCHE
items.remarks:
AD prohibited for gliders and aerostats.
AD reserved for radio-equipped ACFT.
AD prohibited for class 1,2 and 5 ULM and any ULM not equipped with radio and transponder.
AD use between 2200-0600 local time subject to authorization from the AD operator, PN 48HR.

Training patterns reserved for home-based ACFT, prohibited on weekends and public HOL.
Mandatory flight intentions before taxiing, on FREQ TWR.
Transit overhead AD: minimum recommended transit altitude in the presence of traffic in the RWY circuit: 1800ft AMSL.
Handling mandatory for non based ACFT whose MTOW is greater than 3 t.
